pullRequest.title: Issue #3201: Allow to configure if ArrayTrailingComma should ignore si…
pullRequest.bodyText:
Fixes #3201 .
Changes

Added a new property alwaysDemandTrailingComma.
Added UT for the new property.
Update the xdocs and java doc of ArrayTrailingComma.

Diff Report: https://gaurav-punjabi.github.io/checkstyle/3201/index.html
Diff Report with default config : https://gaurav-punjabi.github.io/checkstyle/3201-default/index.html

beforeCommit.message: Issue-3201: Allow to configure if ArrayTrailingComma should ignore single-line array

afterCommit.message: Issue #3201: Allow to configure if ArrayTrailingComma should ignore single-line array

nodes.bodyText:
please add a new line
/**
 * Setter to control ...
 *
 * @param alwaysDemandTrailingComma ...
 */
also I wonder about instead of user's value, maybe restating whether to always check for a trailing comma
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -143,6 +171,19 @@
      */
     public static final String MSG_KEY = "array.trailing.comma";
 
+    /**
+     * Control whether to always check for a trailing comma, even when an array is inline.
+     */
+    private boolean alwaysDemandTrailingComma;
+
+    /**
+     * Setter to control whether to always check for a trailing comma, even when an array is inline.
+     * @param alwaysDemandTrailingComma user's value

nodes.bodyText:
I wonder if it would be easier/harder to read if pulling out alwaysDemandTrailingComma, e.g.
&& (alwaysDemandTrailingComma ||
    (!TokenUtil.areOnSameLine(rcurly, previousSibling) &&
     !TokenUtil.areOnSameLine(arrayInit, previousSibling)))
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -164,8 +205,9 @@ public void visitToken(DetailAST arrayInit) {
         final DetailAST previousSibling = rcurly.getPreviousSibling();
 
         if (arrayInit.getChildCount() != 1
-                && !TokenUtil.areOnSameLine(rcurly, previousSibling)
-                && !TokenUtil.areOnSameLine(arrayInit, previousSibling)
+                && (alwaysDemandTrailingComma || !TokenUtil.areOnSameLine(rcurly, previousSibling))
+                && (alwaysDemandTrailingComma
+                    || !TokenUtil.areOnSameLine(arrayInit, previousSibling))

nodes.bodyText:
please add comment with config explanation (if other than default), e.g.
/* Config:
*  prop1 = true
* prop2 = false
*/

nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -132,6 +139,27 @@ * ,}; // no violation * * + *

To configure check to always validate trailing comma:

+ * 
+ * <module name="ArrayTrailingComma">
+ *   <property name="alwaysDemandTrailingComma" value="true"/>
+ * </module>
+ *
+ *

Example:

+ * 
+ * int[] a = new int[] {1, 2}; // violation, array should contain trailing comma.
+ * String[] b = new String[]{"foo", "bar",}; // ok
+ * int[] c = {1

nodes.bodyText:
what is difference between this example and one in line 152?
also, field name 'c' is in use already
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -132,6 +139,27 @@ * ,}; // no violation * * + *

To configure check to always validate trailing comma:

+ * 
+ * <module name="ArrayTrailingComma">
+ *   <property name="alwaysDemandTrailingComma" value="true"/>
+ * </module>
+ *
+ *

Example:

+ * 
+ * int[] a = new int[] {1, 2}; // violation, array should contain trailing comma.
+ * String[] b = new String[]{"foo", "bar",}; // ok
+ * int[] c = {1
+ *  2 // violation, array should contain trailing comma.
+ * };
+ * int[] d = {
+ * 1}; // violation, array should contain trailing comma.
+ * int[] c = {
+ *     1,
+ *     2 // violation, array should contain trailing comma.
